It may seems like too overpowered at first, but java proved it already that BUD-switch is actually very useful and annoying at the same time.

You mean emissivity, like spider eyes? Agreed.
This is a cool idea and currently the observer is pretty trash, so I like how you're thinking here.

It would also be cool to have a variant that instead of absorbing multiple pulses, absorbs power and distributes leftover. if you set it to 13 absorbtion only a 14 or 15 pulse could get through, filtering out less powerful pulses. This could be useful for small compact designs instead of having to make some big line and stuff. maybe this is already a thing but idrk simpleton like me will get a chance to understand redstone better with that.
I have this problem too. but why not make the block and implement the mechanic directly into the observer?
384754216952 maybe u could set a cooldown for observers. It would be default 0 but u could set it to seconds (or ticks).

The ability to link minecarts together would definitely help make the Furnace Minecart more useful. Perhaps having an inventory for the furnace cart (Hopper fillable) in order to queue fuel would make it even more useful in railroad systems. A rail for locking linked trains via the engine (furnace cart) when a Redstone signal is applied would help with emptying and refilling the Furnace cart, as well as any other carts in the train.

Does it not detect when a melon or pumpkin grows into a spot? I know that the observers can detect the vine change when one is grown. To be more specific, when a melon or pumpkin grows the vine changes position to attach to the melon or pumpkin and the observer can detect that change

Ule Tir, I think TheOther51 means it does not detect when the actual stem changes textures when the pumpkin/melon is produced. If this was fixed, then automatic pumpkin/melon farms will be smaller, more efficient, and make the designs interchangeable between Java and Bedrock. If this doesn't get fixed in Bedrock 1.15, I don't know what to do!
yea i just built a auto farm after I forgot that fact

This is a great idea but it needs to be simplified to a few sentences so people can read it faster. Even if you can't include all your ideas in it the ideas that are most viewed are often short and simple and leave room for people to comment suggestions.
this would be very nice for ender pearl stasis chambers.

love it would make redstone more easy to be integrated into your base without messing everything esthetically.
Finally someone asked for it.

I completely agree, the redstone on the bedrock is broken and on the Java version it works as it should and I hope that the developers will fix it. But what disappoints me most is how the studio that is responsible for bedrock minecraft is irresponsible about their work; they have been fixing bugs or adding things from Java for decades, and they are insignificant, but they greatly affect the gameplay. The only thing they are doing is expanding the marketplace to infinity to squeeze more money out of the game.

Please fix the problem Please because many people have not pc but have phone java can only be played in pc can't be in mobile but bedrock can be played in all devices.so, Please fix only then mobile players enjoy playing
Maybe make it so you can direct copper redstone in the directions you want. You could keep some wires separate, direct redstone signals into components that don't draw in redstone, etc.
YES! copper wire is a great idea.
Cool idea. The wire should still oxidize over time so that you eventually have to replace it or wax it.
something like this would be great for super smelters
A really cool idea. I can already imagine how when certain buttons are pressed in my warehouse, the barrel with resources I need will come out of the wall. It's really cool.

uses of an barrel:

  • movable (yes, try in on your minecraft BEDROCK)
  • workstation for fishermen
  • can be opend even if there is a block above it
  • is a full block unlike a chest so you cannot see a hopper underneath one
Here's a bonus idea to share; make them throwable by Iron Golems.
Itâ€™s impossible, you canâ€™t split out block using sticky piston in bedrock

Well, there's a fix. Use a block that updates with a delay (pistons recommended), and let them update the sticky piston. That way, there's a considerable gap when two pistons can contract at the same time, moving the contraption in one direction. Therefore, two-way flying machines are possible.
... Except there's no wind and you can just use redstone torch/block

I had an idea like this but it was more like the wind pipes in Minecraft Dungeons. I thought it would be cool if we could use a wind turbine and some wind pipes to connect and bring wind wherever you need it. You could make this work in water with a Hydro Turbine and Hydro Pipes. Turbines can be activated by Redstone and if they are not connected to any pipes via the back of the turbine then they will only run the turbine spinning animation on the block. If they are connected to the pipe then from out the back of the pipe there will be a strong gust of air that can blow entities down, up, sideways, and can even make them hover. When you try to use a Wind Turbine underwater it will not work and will not produce air, and when you try to shoot wind into the water it will just spew out some bubbles. Hydro Bubble Turbines would be crafted with soul sand or magma blocks to aim bubble column in any direction. Normal Hydro Turbines would simply suck in water and the pipes they are connected to will spit it out.

I think it would be cool to add ultra-boosted minecarts, but the thing is, ice boats slide and are slippery, allowing you to make fun obstacle courses out of them. You can also choose what direction you're going, and can stop. Good idea, though.

@TheIlluminix Choosing your direction, and the ability to stop, are all easily accessible within a minecart as well, and the obstacle course potential stemming from ice-boats is a natural side effect of a fundamentally broken and silly mechanic- something better could be done.
so true
I think it's enough to just detect the item frames,like the Bedrock :)
Would be very useful for programmable flying machines using items. They would be 10x more compact.
